intro: Eranthemum corcovadense, commonly known as the coral bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Eranthemum corcovadense thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
